about.summary: A general-purpose computational engine for data analysis, drake rebuilds intermediate data objects when their dependencies change, and it skips work when the results are already up to date. Not every execution starts from scratch, there is native support for parallel and distributed computing, and completed projects have tangible evidence that they are reproducible. Extensive documentation, from beginner-friendly tutorials to practical examples and more, is available at the reference website <https://ropensci.github.io/drake/> and the online manual <https://ropenscilabs.github.io/drake-manual/>.

A general-purpose computational engine for data analysis, drake rebuilds intermediate data objects when their dependencies change, and it skips work when the results are already up to date. Extensive documentation, from beginner-friendly tutorials to practical examples and more, is available at the reference website <https://ropensci.github.io/drake/> and the online manual <https://ropenscilabs.github.io/drake-manual/>.

name: r-drake

about.summary: A general-purpose computational engine for data analysis, drake rebuilds intermediate data objects when their dependencies change, and it skips work when the results are already up to date. Not every execution starts from scratch, there is native support for parallel and distributed computing, and completed projects have tangible evidence that they are reproducible. Extensive documentation, from beginner-friendly tutorials to practical examples and more, is available at the reference website <https://ropensci.github.io/drake/> and the online manual <https://ropenscilabs.github.io/drake-manual/>.

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "7.13.11" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-drake
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/drake_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/drake/drake_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 4de93e210268af4cc1aa8650fd0fd9b042685a30b47a00d49d22ac9ed8ea4b45

build:
  number: 1
  # Checking windows to see if it passes. Uncomment the line if it fails.
  # skip: true  # [win]
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ compiler('c') }}              # [not win]
    - {{ stdlib("c") }}                # [not win]
    - {{ compiler('m2w64_c') }}        # [win]
    - {{ stdlib("m2w64_c") }}          # [win]
    - {{ posix }}filesystem        # [win]
    - {{ posix }}make
    - {{ posix }}sed               # [win]
    - {{ posix }}coreutils         # [win]
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-base64url
    - r-digest >=0.6.21
    - r-igraph
    - r-rlang >=0.2.0
    - r-storr >=1.1.0
    - r-tidyselect >=1.0.0
    - r-txtq >=0.2.3
    - r-vctrs >=0.2.0
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-base64url
    - r-digest >=0.6.21
    - r-igraph
    - r-rlang >=0.2.0
    - r-storr >=1.1.0
    - r-tidyselect >=1.0.0
    - r-txtq >=0.2.3
    - r-vctrs >=0.2.0

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('drake')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('drake')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/ropensci/drake
  license: GPL-3.0-only
  summary: A general-purpose computational engine for data analysis, drake rebuilds intermediate data objects when their dependencies change, and it skips work when the results are already up to date. Not every execution starts from scratch, there is native support for parallel and distributed computing, and completed projects
    have tangible evidence that they are reproducible. Extensive documentation, from beginner-friendly tutorials to practical examples and more, is available at the reference website <https://ropensci.github.io/drake/> and the online manual <https://ropenscilabs.github.io/drake-manual/>.
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-3

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - brendanf
    - wlandau
